newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil to divulge 1996 deficit figures Friday.
newsitem.headline: Brazil to divulge 1996 deficit figures Friday.

text.p: Brazil's Central Bank will divulge the 1996 public sector operational deficit at 1100 local/1400 GMT Friday, a spokesman said.
The bank will also reveal January monetary base aggregates, deficit figures and debt levels, he added.
Altamir Lopes, head of the bank's economics department, has previously confirmed market predictions of a 4.5 percent of gross domestic product operational deficit last year.
On Tuesday this week, he told Reuters that though the results were not completely finalized, the trend suggested a "pleasant surprise". He did not elaborate.
Brazil posted an operational deficit of 5 percent of GDP in 1995 and the government originally intended to halve that shortfall in 1996.

Its aim to slash the gap to about 2.5 percent of GDP this year was dealt a blow Wednesday when the Supreme Federal Tribunal, the country's highest court, ruled in favor of a 28.9 percent wage claim lodged by 11 civil servants.
The government fears the pay rise could be extended to up to one million other public sector workers, putting considerable strain on its finances.
